# usesFindPanel

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver allows for a find panel.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var usesFindPanel: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to allow the use of a find panel, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise. A text view can use either a find panel or a find bar. If [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/usesFindPanel] is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/usesFindBar] is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] and vice versa.

## Related Documentation

- **usesFindBar**: A Boolean value that indicates whether to use the find bar for this text view.

## Working with panels

- **usesFontPanel**: A Boolean value that controls whether the text views sharing the receiver’s layout manager use the Font panel and Font menu.
- **performFindPanelAction(_:)**: Performs a find panel action specified by the sender’s tag.
- **orderFrontLinkPanel(_:)**: Brings forward a panel allowing the user to manipulate links in the text view.
- **orderFrontListPanel(_:)**: Brings forward a panel allowing the user to manipulate text lists in the text view.
- **orderFrontSpacingPanel(_:)**: Brings forward a panel allowing the user to manipulate text line heights, interline spacing, and paragraph spacing, in the text view.
- **orderFrontTablePanel(_:)**: Brings forward a panel allowing the user to manipulate text tables in the text view.
- **orderFrontSubstitutionsPanel(_:)**: Brings forward a panel allowing the user to specify string substitutions in the text view.
